message.content:
When you were 6 years old and your sister was half your age, she would have been 3 years old (since 6 divided by 2 is 3). Since then, both of you have aged together.

Now that you are 80, you've aged 74 years (from 6 to 80), so your sister has also aged 74 years. To find her current age, subtract the initial 3-year difference from her total aging:

\[ \text{Sister's current age} = 74 \text{ years} - 3 \text{ years} = 71 \text{ years} \]

So your sister is now 71 years old.
